cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Caribbean, forecast to turn northwest across Cuba and then toward Florida’s west coast and the eastern Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast near the Tampa Bay / Manatee County area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches limited to northern Leeward Islands, north coast of Dominican Republic, Cayman Brac/Little Cayman, and portions of eastern Cuba—none yet issued for Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings for southern Hispaniola, Jamaica; tropical-storm warnings along parts of Dominican Republic and Haiti—none yet for Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward & Leeward Islands, southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, and projected Florida west coast from the Keys northward to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) possible at the port late 5–6 Jul; low (8%) chance of 50-kt winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests minor surge 2–4 ft possible along Tampa Bay / Port Manatee coastline if Elsa approaches from the south-southwest
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could bring 4–6 inches with localized higher totals, producing ponding and dock-side flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas, dangerous surf and rip currents preceding the center; possible short-fuse tornadoes in outer rain bands
